page.title: 13ANGLING IN CHRISTCHURCH
page.content: The two local rivers,the Hampshire Avon and the Dorset Stour are famous nationally for the quality of their game and coarse fishing. Much of the fishing is strictly private, but day-tickets can be purchased for two of the most famous fisheries, the Royalty Fisheries on the Avon and Throop Fisheries on the Stour. The two rivers vary considerably in character: the Avon being a steady flowing, spring fed, chalkstream; the Stour is more responsive to rainfall, liable to rise quickly after heavy rain. Both rivers are very weedy, the Avon though has its weed cut in the summer- a practice which most anglers believe has a detrimental effect on the quality of the fishing. Salmon and sea-trout migrate up both rivers. Coarse fish include large barbel, chub, roach,pike,dace and perch.
